symptoms of hyponatremia
Which patient is at highest risk for having a sodium level of 130 mEq/L?
questions.resources: Answer A (45 p.99) 1. Hyponatremia less than 135. Hyperaldosteronism is Cushing’s syndrome and the patient taking corticosteroids can result in hypernatremia.

questions.question: What are the signs of hyponatremia?
questions.resources: Answer D (46 p.99) Hyperactive bowel sounds, muscle weakness, increased urine output​ and decreased specific gravity are all signs of hyponatremia. Hypernatremia signs are muscle twitches, decreased urine output, increased specific gravity.

questions.question: If the patient has a serum sodium of 150 mEq/L  which foods should the client avoid?
questions.resources: Answer 4 (41 p.99) Normal sodium level 135-145. It is hypernatremia, Nuts, cauliflower, and peas are good sources of phosphorous. Process foods tend to be high in sodium

questions.question: a patient with numbness, hyperactive deep tendon reflexes, hyperactive bowel sounds, twitching?
questions.resources:
4.	Which laboratory result would expect in a patient with numbness, hyperactive deep tendon reflexes, hyperactive bowel sounds, twitching, anxiety, and a positive Chvostek ‘s sign?
a.	Hyperkalemia
Answer 3 (42, p.99) Ca 8.6-10 mg/dL Hypocalcemia signs & sx paresthesias, numbness, hyperactive deep tendon reflexes, a positive Chvostek’s or Trousseau’s sign, increased neuromuscular excitability, muscle cramps, twitching, tetany, seizures, irritability, and anxiety, increased gastric motility, hyperactive bowel sounds, abdominal cramping

questions.question: an assessment of a pt. with acute hemorrhage and anemia, you would most likely expect to find:
questions.resources: The heart rate will increase in an attempt to deliver more oxygen to the tissues. The body will also compensate by increasing the blood pressure, hypotension will not be expected in the acute phase.

questions.question: of anemia secondary to a nutritional deficiency, which question is important to ask the patient

choices.answer: “Do you experience numbness or tingling in your extremities?
“What over-the-counter medications do you take regularly?
“Have you noticed your gums bleed when you brush your teeth'
“Have you noticed if your stools have changed color"?
